page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content: Burntwood is relatively modern but there is a long tradition of education, dating back to the Academy founded by Dr. Samuel Johnson at Edial. There are records of small schools in the Trade Directories of the mid 19th Century. A school still remains on the site of the first one built in 1865, rebuilt in 1911 and subsequently modernized near St. Anne's in Church St. The village school in Hammerwich however has closed recently. The area schools date back to the expansion of the 1960's when Chastown High was built to co-exist alongside Chaseterrace in the Burntwood area. Children attend first schools from 5-9 yrs, then move to a high school at 13 from a middle school. There has also been a crisis with a threatened amalga- mation of the two high schools but this is to be reviewed in 1986.
